Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 10:05AM Lifes-A-Beach wrote: If you feel like you want more answers you should get a recommendation to a BS and ask for a biopsy..Also remember to get copies of your mammo reports from radiology! I went 2 yrs on a wait and watch schedule with my old doctor til I finally found a BS that would do a biopsy on the area of concern in my breast..Granted it was non-palapable so was only visible on mammo/us.. My biopsy came back benign..Remember as well that 80% of breast lumps are benign :)

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 03:33PM Lifes-A-Beach wrote: I'm thinking they will set you up with an appointment for a mammo/us if you haven't already had one..At least that was the protocol for my breast lump.. Posts.Title: Lump in left armpit pea sized, Scared to DEATH to go to dr. O_O SmileItsP Kimmer1975

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2011 03:23PM Lifes-A-Beach wrote: Kaara, I just had a stereotactic bio in Sept..It didn't hurt the only thing I felt was the needle for the lidocane other than that it was just a little pressure from each of the 6 samples she took..Mine was large enough to be seen on ultrasound but she could not aspirate anything from the mass (the fine needle aspiration attempt hurt alot worse for me). You may want to take something to calm your nerves if you don't handle procedures well, I did not take anything drove myself to and from appt.  Just make sure to wear a button up shirt (wish I would've known this) and if you have a bra that fastens in the front would be great as well. Make sure to ice the area.. Best wishes and I hope your biopsy goes smoothly!
